_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:31:01 using v2.7
title: How have referral to treatment times changed in the short term?
analysis_commentary: Waiting times show small fluctuations from month to month. On the graph a line has been added to show the underlying trend. This trend in median wait times from referral to decision to treat for admitted people has increased slightly by 0.4 weeks since July 2012, and incomplete pathways has increased by 0.3 weeks. For people who are not admitted for treatment, the median wait time has also been increasing, from 4.1 weeks in July 2012, to 5.2 weeks in July 2014.
data_source: NHS England, Referral to Treatment waiting times
